sentence: Universal Forest Products Inc.UFPI reported impressive results for third-quarter 2015.
The company's net income of $25.6 million marked the highest for a September-ending quarter since its inception.
Earnings came in at $1.26 per share, beating the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $1.19.
Also, the bottom line grew 31.3% from the year-ago tally of 96 cents.
The year-over-year improvement was driven by healthy performance in all end markets, especially retail and industrial.
This was suitably complemented by lower cost of sales, which led to improved margins.
Universal Forest Products generated net sales of $762.3 million, increasing 6.8% year over year.
The year-over-year rise was attributable to strong growth of unit sales in the company's three end market-based segments, partially offset by weakness in the lumber market.
In the nine months ended Sep 2015, Universal Forest Products generated revenues of $181.2 million from new products sales, up from $143.6 million a year ago.
Total gross sales (net sales including sales allowances) were $773.2 million, up 7% year over year.
The three end market-based segments, namely, Retail Building Materials, Industrial, and Housing & Construction, represented approximately 38.2%, 30.5% and 31.3%, respectively, of total gross sales.

A brief snapshot of end-market sales has been provided below:

Retail Building Materials revenues were up 9% year over year to $295.4 million.
Industrial sales were recorded at $236 million, up 11% year over year.
Sales in the Housing and Construction end-market were $241.8 million, increasing 1% year over year.
Universal Forest Products' margin performance in the quarter improved year over year.
As a percentage of revenues, cost of sales decreased 190 basis points (bps) to 85.5%.
Higher net sales and lower costs of sales drove a year-over-year increase of 190 bps in gross margin.
Selling, general and administrative expenses stood at roughly $68 million, accounting for 8.9% of net sales.
Exiting third-quarter 2015, Universal Forest Products had cash and cash equivalents of $61.3 million compared with $24.8 million in the preceding quarter.
Long-term debt decreased 30.7% sequentially to $84.7 million.
Universal Forest Products' cash position improved in the first nine months of 2015.
Cash generated from operating activities totaled $121.4 million, up 72.1% year over year.
Capital spent on purchase of property, plant and equipment amounted to $36.5 million as against $31.7 million used in first nine months of 2014.
During the period, Universal Forest Products rewarded its shareholders with dividend payments of $8.1 million and bought back shares worth $0.8 million.
For 2015, Universal Forest Products expects an improvement in the top line, backed by the addition of new customers and products to its portfolio.
Also, enhancement of operating margin remains the primary area of focus.
By 2017, Universal Forest Products anticipates generating annual revenues of $250 million from sale of new products.
With a market capitalization of $1.2 billion, Universal Forest Products carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).
Record third-quarter results will likely boost investors' confidence in the stock, thereby, improving its investment value.
Currently, investors interested in the building products industry can consider stocks like Acuity Brands, Inc. AYI , Builders FirstSource, Inc. BLDR and The Home Depot, Inc. HD .
Each of these holds a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
